messages.message:
everyone, frontend based input validation is a thing... this is a super basic principle and we fail to do it in several places. @alagu @hannah @margaret.tomaszczuk @Kerry

almost feel like we have to do an inventory of this....

the confidence validation UI issue has been reported multiple times and is tracked as part of https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2605

cc @Kaustubh (KD) @Weiming Wu
agree with the feedback -- we should do an audit and also add this functionality to pollen input widget if we haven't. cc @Liam Callanan
description length in deployments (error message is worse, but I assume it's the same problem?)
SLAs in deployments has the right input validations, but you can still click save while there's a decimal point:

Pollen could provide helpers for auto-formatting to either an int/decimal but we should mindfully decide what the right option is for any given feature.
That linked ticket is an example of a feature-level issue: some special formatting outside of Pollen (Pollen inputs donâ€™t force integers by default) was likely added but never caught during bug bashes/testing/etc.

From a design/UX perspective we may want to get into the habit of using more input-level validations rather than show error messages on submit i.e. always make it as impossible as we can to misinput data

I'm going to create an epic for these kinds of issues that we can add tickets to. I'll add these instances. It would be great if the design team could do a sweep of where/how they think we should  showing validations in various places and add tickets, and then I can assign them.

The three factors I can think of contributing to this are:
1. Miscommunications between frontend/backend when restrictions are added on backend and frontend is not aware of them (like character or length restrictions)
2. Making sure these validations are noted in designs and people are looking out for them during bug bashes
3. Frontend engineer attention to these validations - lots of things to think about during implementation and sometimes these things do get missed! We'll chat about this in the next frontend guild just to bring this into the top of people's awareness
At the very least, the decimals in validation rule thing was a bug rather than an oversight, and it was fixed last week and included in 24.46.
@Jessica I think (3) should catch the vast majority of obvious issues
e.g. it should be clear that a page range field shouldnt allow random characters like "asdf"
and that most text boxes should have some sort of length limit validation
@Weiming Wu can you pick the bug fix back to 24.44 -- so it gets shipped earlier
Here is the epic we can add things to: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-10324
